creator: mgoldhahn@gmail.com
text:
I did some modifications to the Jakarta ISAPI filter in
connectors/trunk/jk/native. It would be nice to see most of them included the
distribution.
1. a new worker parameter: socket_nodelay, default 1 2. parameter
socket_timeout: the documentation stated that if the parameter was set to zero
it would wait infinitely, however, the code
says: if it is set larger than zero, change it, i.e. if it were set to zero the
system default would be used. The new implementation is: If it is set to -1 the
socket timeout is set to infinitely. If it is set to larger or equal to zero,
the socket timeout is set to the given value in seconds. Any other value will
use the system default.
3. The status worker has a new button, that reloads the configuration.
This allows one to change the filter settigns without having to restart IIS.
This feature is not tested thoroughly, e.g. we have to make sure that all
incoming requests are stalled and all active requests are served until the
configuration is reloaded.
4. Errors in WriteClient() are ignored, see
http://west-wind.com/weblog/posts/1266.aspx
5. The last parameter in the ServerSupportFunction should be the length of the
headers buffer (not the length of the status buffer)

Like the README.txt inside native/isapi states:

This connector is unsupported!
Use native/iis instead for using iside Microsoft IIS.
creator: mturk@apache.org
mgoldhahn@gmail.com
text:
I don't know how you deducted that this patch was for
connectors/trunk/jk/native/isapi. It is not. The patch is for
connectors/trunk/jk/native/iis. To my knowledge this where the code for the
current Jakarata redirector resides.

Hi,

Can you split the patch to multiple ones, each for each file.
Also please use spaces instead tab characters.

Thanks.
creator: mturk@apache.org

text:
There are too many patches here that require at least
the minor version bump.
Some patches are already commited, while some will have to
wait the 1.3 branch.
creator: mturk@apache.org
